results.name: wordpress-app/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-c5cfbb9c8-tc28c Pod/wordpress-c5cfbb9c8-cdsnt], expected 2

Service wordpress-app/wordpress has event failed to get cpu utilization: unable to get metrics for resource cpu: unable to fetch metrics from resource metrics API: the server could not find the requested resource (get pods.metrics.k8s.io)

Service wordpress-app/wordpress has event invalid metrics (1 invalid out of 1), first error is: failed to get cpu resource metric value: failed to get cpu utilization: unable to get metrics for resource cpu: unable to fetch metrics from resource metrics API: the server could not find the requested resource (get pods.metrics.k8s.io)

results.details:
Error: The service "wordpress-app/wordpress" lacks ready endpoints due to issues fetching CPU metrics, as the server can't find the requested resource.

Solution: 
1. Ensure Metrics Server is deployed.
2. Check RBAC permissions for metrics access.
3. Verify API server connectivity.
4. Restart Metrics Server if needed.

results.name: wordpress-app/wordpress-c5cfbb9c8-cdsnt

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.
